root.name: lerp()

example.code:
# Non-static (lerp on a specific vector) current = None target = None
def setup(): current = PVector(0.0, 0.0) target = PVector(100.0, 100.0) current.lerp(target, 0.5) println(current)# Prints "[ 50.0, 50.0, 0.0 ]"

# Static (return a vector) start = None end = None middle = None
def setup(): start = PVector(0.0, 0.0) end = PVector(100.0, 100.0) middle = PVector.lerp(start, end, 0.5) println(middle) # Prints "[ 50.0, 50.0, 0.0 ]"
# Non-static (lerp on a specific vector) PVector v def setup(): v = PVector(0.0, 0.0) def draw(): v.lerp(mouseX, mouseY, 0.0, 0.1) ellipse(v.x, v.y, 20, 20)

root.description:
Calculates linear interpolation from one vector to another vector. (Just like regular lerp(), but for vectors.)

Note that there is one static version of this method, and two non-static versions. The static version, lerp(v1, v2, amt) is given the two vectors to interpolate and returns a new PVector object. The static version is used by referencing the PVector class directly. (See the middle example above.) The non-static versions, lerp(v, amt) and lerp(x, y, z, amt), do not return a new PVector, but transform the values of the PVector on which they are called. These non-static versions function the same way, but the former takes another vector as input, while the latter takes three float values. (See the top and bottom examples above, respectively.)
root.syntax: .lerp(v, amt) .lerp(v1, v2, amt) .lerp(x, y, z, amt)

parameter.label: v
parameter.description: PVector: the vector to lerp to

parameter.label: amt
parameter.description: float: The amount of interpolation; some value between 0.0 (old vector) and 1.0 (new vector). 0.1 is very near the new vector. 0.5 is halfway in between.

parameter.label: v1
parameter.description: PVector: the vector to start from

parameter.label: v2
parameter.description: PVector: the vector to lerp to

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: float: the x component to lerp to

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: float: the y component to lerp to

parameter.label: z
parameter.description: float: the z component to lerp to
